original_theorem:
A subset $T$ of a metric $A$ is compact if and only if
every infinite sequence $\{t_n\}$ of members of  $T$  has a
subsequence that converges to a member of $T.$
theorem_translation:
```lean4
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0

open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter

theorem compact_iff_sequence_converges_subsequence {Œ± : Type*} [MetricSpace Œ±] (T : Set Œ±) :
    IsCompact T ‚Üî (‚àÄ (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí T), ‚àÉ (g : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono g ‚àß (‚àÉ (x : T), Filter.Tendsto (f ‚àò g) Filter.atTop (nhds x))) := by
```

attempt_history.verified_code:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0

open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter

theorem compact_iff_sequence_converges_subsequence {Œ± : Type*} [MetricSpace Œ±] (T : Set Œ±) :
    IsCompact T ‚Üî (‚àÄ (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí T), ‚àÉ (g : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono g ‚àß (‚àÉ (x : T), Filter.Tendsto (f ‚àò g) Filter.atTop (nhds x))) := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
‚Ä¢ Let $\{t_n\}$ be an infinite sequence of members of $T \subseteq A$ [tc_1].
‚Ä¢ The set of values $\{t_n \mid n \in \mathbb{N}\}$ is finite.
Therefore, we conclude:
‚Ä¢ There exists a point $\overline{t} \in T$ and a strictly increasing sequence of natural numbers $(n_j)_{j \in \mathbb{N}}$ such that $t_{n_j} = \overline{t}$ for all $j$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
by_cases h_f_finite : Set.Finite (Set.range f)
  . obtain ‚ü®y, hy_freq‚ü© := Set.exists_freq_of_finite_range h_f_finite
    obtain ‚ü®g, hg_mono, h_f_g_eq_y‚ü© := hy_freq.tendsto_atTop
    refine ‚ü®g, hg_mono, y, ?_‚ü©
    simp only [Filter.Tendsto, nhds_singleton, Filter.le_principal_iff]
    intro U hU
    filter_upwards [h_f_g_eq_y]
    intro n hn
    rwa [hn]

```lean4
  intro h_compact
  intro f
  let S := Set.range f
  by_cases h_S_finite : S.Finite
  . rcases h_S_finite with ‚ü®s, hs‚ü©
    rcases Set.finite_of_bijective (Set.rangeFactorization f) (Set.rangeFactorization_bijective f) with ‚ü®s‚ÇÄ, hs‚ÇÄ‚ü©
    have : Set.Finite (Set.range f) := by
      rw [‚Üê hs]
      exact Set.finite_coe_iff.mpr hs‚ÇÄ
    obtain ‚ü®y, hy‚ü© := Set.exists_freq_at_least_of_finite this (Set.range f)
    obtain ‚ü®g, hg_mono, hg_eq‚ü© := Set.frequently_atTop.mp hy
    use g
    refine ‚ü®hg_mono, y, ?_‚ü©
    simp only [Filter.Tendsto, nhds_singleton, Filter.le_principal_iff]
    intro U hU
    filter_upwards [hg_eq]
    intro n hn
    rw [hn]
    exact hU
```

attempt_history.verified_code:
import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0

open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter

theorem compact_iff_sequence_converges_subsequence {Œ± : Type*} [MetricSpace Œ±] (T : Set Œ±) :
    IsCompact T ‚Üî (‚àÄ (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí T), ‚àÉ (g : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono g ‚àß (‚àÉ (x : T), Filter.Tendsto (f ‚àò g) Filter.atTop (nhds x))) := by
  intro h_compact
  intro f
  let S := Set.range f
  by_cases h_S_finite : S.Finite
  . rcases h_S_finite with ‚ü®s, hs‚ü©
    rcases Set.finite_of_bijective (Set.rangeFactorization f) (Set.rangeFactorization_bijective f) with ‚ü®s‚ÇÄ, hs‚ÇÄ‚ü©
    have : Set.Finite (Set.range f) := by
      rw [‚Üê hs]
      exact Set.finite_coe_iff.mpr hs‚ÇÄ
    obtain ‚ü®y, hy‚ü© := Set.exists_freq_at_least_of_finite this (Set.range f)
    obtain ‚ü®g, hg_mono, hg_eq‚ü© := Set.frequently_atTop.mp hy
    use g
    refine ‚ü®hg_mono, y, ?_‚ü©
    simp only [Filter.Tendsto, nhds_singleton, Filter.le_principal_iff]
    intro U hU
    filter_upwards [hg_eq]
    intro n hn
    rw [hn]
    exact hU
  sorry
